channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside TOAST, 28a Hampstead High Street, 11th November
item.description:
A pavement flag stone is wobbly and causing a trip hazard. Last night a customer fell over when outside the store and broke her foot and ankle.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hampstead High Street, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obscene grafitti on the bins and bus stop, 11th November
item.description:
The 401 bus stop by Bedonwell Road/Streamway has some obscene graffiti on the yellow bins and on the glass of the bus stop itself. The issue has been there since at least September
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grosvenor Road, Upper Belvedere, London

item.title: Flags put as racism, 11th November
item.description:
I received an update yesterday saying:Thank you for your report. The issue has been resolved and the case is closed. State changed to: Fixed However it is not true as you can see in the picture attached. Unfortunately I cannot reply to the email I received

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Globe Pond Road, Rotherhithe, London

item.title: Outside 149 Star Lane, 11th November
item.description:
This vehicle hass been parked here for a while now. There are people going in and out day night and I believe some even sleep in tje vehicle. There is a lot of suspicious activity going on and at night it gets worse as there is a lot of noise going on that disrupts our sleep. They litter rubbish and alcohol cans on the road. A lot of people gather around and it is always intimidating to go out. This is too much for residents!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 163, Star Lane, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken safety barriers and bollards, 11th November
item.description:
Along the pavement, several sections of the wooden fence are broken. During busy times, pupils and parents may slip or step into the vegetation or even onto the roadway. At least 14 wooden bollards are missing, which would otherwise prevent vehicles from mounting the pavement and posing a danger to pupils and pedestrians. The roadway is also covered in vegetation, including leaves and mud, making the surface very slippery when wet. Pupils and parents waiting along the pavement are therefore at increased risk.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beddington Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Not detecting cyclists, 11th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Redriff Road, Rotherhithe, London

item.title: Pavement Parking Boxes, 11th November
item.description:
The Pavement Parking Box, the white lines have almost disappeared now. I would like them repainted to stop me and my Neighbours getting more parking tickets. I have reported this 2 months ago and has still not been done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northdown Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builders dumped waste and Mattress blocking pathway, 11th November
item.description:
Builders are constantly dumping waste and heavy rubbish blocking our only entry and exit pathway. Please put camera to catch the culprit. Also put a sign that Fly Tipping here is illegal and will be prosecuted. Area is full of rubbish and health hazard. Please take urgent action.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Simms Road, Bermondsey, London
